text: Robin Thicke net worth: Robin Thicke is an American singer, producer and song writer who has a net worth of $15 million dollars. Robin Thicke was born on March 10, 1977 in Los Angeles, California. He is the son of actors Alan Thicke and Gloria Loring. Robin knew he wanted to be a singer from a very early age. When his father objected, Robin borrowed $1000 from an uncle to record a demo tape. That demo tape made the rounds to a few notable musicians. When Brian McKnight heard the tape, he invited Robin into the studio to lay down some tracks. Robin released his debut album "A Beautiful World" in 2003. His second album was 2006's "The Evolution of Robin Thicke" which sold 1.5 million copies worldwide and reached #1 on the US R&B chart and #5 on the Billboard 100 chart. Thicke's album Something Else was released in 2008 and reached #3 on both the Billboard 200 and US R&B charts. His album Sex Therapy: The Session was released in 2009 and reached #2 on the US R&B chart and #9 on the Billboard 200. Thicke released the album Love After War in 2011 which reached #6 on the US R&B chart. His 2013 album Blurred Lines reached #1 on both the Billboard 200 and US R&B charts as well as in Canada, Switzerland, and the UK, and produced the single of the same name which has since gone on to become one of the most popular singles of all time. "Blurred Lines" the single reached #1 on the Billboard charts and sold tens of millions of copies worldwide. His album Paula was released in 2014 and reached #2 on the US R&B and #9 on the Billboard 200 charts. Thicke has also written hit songs for many other artists including Guy Sebastian, Angela Via, 50 Cent, Lil' Wayne, Christina Aguilera, and Jennifer Hudson. Robin was married to actress Paula Patton, whom he has been dating since the age of 16. They welcomed a son named Julian Fuego Thicke in April of 2010. Robin and Paula separated in February of 2014.
